SWS Train 822 Is Delayed
SWS Train 822 Schedule to arrive Chicago at 5:55 PM is currently operating 30 minutes behind schedule due to positive train control issues.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Van Buren Street - Michigan Ave.
Van Buren Street - Michigan Ave. elevator is out of service. Alternative accessible locations are Millennium station and 11th Place - Museum Campus.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/RI?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
RID 305 additional stops

RID train #305 scheduled to arrive Joliet at 6:22 pm will be making additional stops at Mokena-Hickory Creek, Mokena-Front Street, New Lenox and Joliet and may incur a 30 minute delay due to the earlier derailment.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME #709 Delayed 15-20 Minutes
Outbound train #709 scheduled to arrive University Park at 7:20 P.M. may be operating 15-20 minutes behind schedule due to positive train control issues.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Millennium Station Elevator
The Millennium Station elevator is currently out of service. Alternative accessible locations are South Water and 11th Place - Museum Campus.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
Ivanhoe Station North Stairway
The north stairway at the Ivanhoe station is out of service. Customers must use the elevator until further notice. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert BNSF - Attention Berwyn Commuters: Starting July 5, 2023, Stanley Avenue will be under construction for approximately 14 weeks.
Attention Berwyn Commuters: Starting July 5, 2023, Stanley Avenue will be under construction for approximately 14 weeks. Please use caution through the work zone and allow extra travel time.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 79th street/Chatham Station Closure Beginning July 10 - Station Rebuild Project

The 79th street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, July 10 for approximately 7 months. During this time passengers can use 75th and 83rd street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, stations will have enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrances, lobbies with elevators, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage.  For more information click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert HC - Metra to offer Saturday "Rails, Trails and Ales" Excursions on the Heritage Corridor Beginning September 9

Metra will be offering special service on the Heritage Corridor Line beginning Saturday, September 9 through October 14 giving Chicago area residents opportunities to explore the bike and running paths, festivals, craft breweries, restaurants, and vibrant communities along the historic route. Full schedules can be viewed at metra.com
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Grayslake Platform Construction

Platform construction at the Grayslake station will prohibit boarding on the west end of the platform. This will restrict boarding using the center pedestrian crossing. During this time, passengers will have to go to Lake street to cross and board trains.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Weekend track construction through January 16, 2024

Track construction will be taking place every weekend at the Grayland station, Rondout, and the Everett crosssing  through January 16, 2024. Trains may incur delays enroute up to 15 minutes behind schedule passing through the work zone on Saturday and Sunday until the work is complete. Please listen to announcements for any platform changes. For additional information visit metra.com/constructionnotices.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - University Park station stairway out of service. Customers must use the ramp until further notice.
The stairway at the University Park station is out of service. Customers must use the ramp until further notice. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-N - North Chicago Station Renovation
The North Chicago Station will be undergoing renovation for approximately 4 to 6 weeks. Customers will not have access to the warming house beginning August 22, 2023.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI -   Rock Island Limited Outbound Service

Due to a derailment earlier today, there will be limited outbound service on the Rock Island Line for the evening rush. Outbound trains may incur up to 55 minute delays.  Passengers may also look to the Metra Electric, Southwest Service and the Heritage Corridor as alternative. Click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI -  Inbound service will be suspended until further notice.
Inbound service will be suspended until further notice.  Passengers may also look to the Southwest Service as alternative.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Metra anticipates operating a normal schedule

Metra anticipates operating a normal schedule tomorrow. Trains may incur up to 15 minute delays due to the earlier derailment. Please listen to platform announcements and visit metra.com for schedule information.
